TextView.android:text: 1. Fundamentals Circuit theory and analysis. Ohm’s Law, Kirchhoff’s Laws, or Thevenin’s Theorem. 2. Electronics Semiconductors, diodes, and transistors. Operational amplifiers (Op-Amps) and their applications. Digital electronics: Logic gates, flip-flops, or microcontrollers. 3. Power Systems Generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity. Renewable energy technologies (solar, wind, etc.). Power electronics and inverters. 4. Communication Systems Analog and digital communication principles. Signal processing and modulation techniques. 5. Control Systems Feedback systems and stability analysis. Applications of PID controllers. 6. Embedded Systems Microcontroller programming (e.g., Arduino, Raspberry Pi). Internet of Things (IoT) projects. 7. Robotics Motor drivers, sensors, and control mechanisms. Integration with AI or machine learning. 8. Career Advice EEE job prospects in industries like automation, telecommunications, or renewable energy. Certifications (e.g., MATLAB, AutoCAD Electrical).
